个人认为，这部游戏从各方面看都堪称神作。这部2011年发布的游戏，到了18年依然能让我惊叹。就单人游戏而言，游戏剧情很有意义，故事情节跌宕起伏、扣人心弦；游戏音乐与剧情配合恰当，使人沉浸于一种未来科技的体验当中；游戏的玩法更是极具创意，很多关卡都极其烧脑，又让人欲罢不能，那种花很长时间终于成功通关的快感实在是太爽了。
目前我只玩了单人游戏，听说还有其他很多模式也很好玩，总体来说这是一部值得一玩的佳作。
love this game always played and watched other people play it when I was younger

게임이란 이런 거구나. 하고 느끼게 해준 게임. 한편의 잘만든 영화와도 같았다.
중간중간 어떻게 해야될지 몰라 갈팡질팡했지만,  이것이 게임이기에, 하나의 '답이 있는' 퍼즐이라고 믿고 집중하니 깰 수 있었다. 답이 있는지 조차 불확실하다면 끝까지 못깼을 지도 모르겠다.

잘 만든 영화같고, 한 편의 그림같고,  재미있는 소설 혹은 동화같고, 멋진 나무같다.

Portal 2 ist ähnlich wie sein Vorgänger, welchen ich auch sehr gern gespielt hab.
Man muss halt einfach nur Portale schießen. Das würde wohl jemand sagen, der noch nie Portal gesielt hat.
Man muss aber schon ein bisschen mehr tun. Zum Beispiel muss man Würfel transportieren und an der richtigen Stelle platzieren, oder auch andere Dinge.
Ich finde das Spiel macht nicht nur zu zweit spaß, sondern auch die Kampagne macht alleine sehr viel spaß.
Ich denke daher, dass man sich das Spiel im Angebot auf jeden Fall kaufen sollte!
Jeu à faire en coop, vraiment sympa!

Valve and their inabality to count to three is a dream that breaks gamer's hearts everywhere. The main negative with Portal 2 is that there will never be another one. It seems that Steam is comitted all it's resoursces to being the biggest online game store and has all but given up up on sequels to Half-Life, Left for Dead and the beloved Portal series. 

This game is truly something special as it mixed comedy with some of the best puzzling availabe in any video game. Who doesn't love the twisted and deranged Glados constantly going to war with the silent Chell. Portal 2 did everything bigger and better. There were more cinematic moments, the inclusion of slime to mix things up and the exploration of the entire facility. Hell, they even added multiplayer to continue the antics with a buddy. The Portal series still has so much potential to explore, few games create every create a truly unique experience. But hey, smile because it happened right?

Excellent puzzle game with an interesting backdrop and story. I found Gladys (the enemy) engaging and funny. The graphics are very good and you won't find many games out there with the unique style this one has.  Every gamer worth their weight in salt needs to have played the Portal Games. This one was arguably better than the first.
1st one better but that's like comparing two masterpieces.

Portal 2 was a very important game in my childhood, and so will always have a special place in my heart. I would strongly recommend this game to anyone who hasn’t already played it, as it is one of the best games of all time on almost all lists. 

The game is split up into three main acts, each with their own unique feel and place in the lore of the game. The first act is Aperture Science as we know and love, except we see it very run-down from the aftermath of the first game. The second act takes the player back through Aperture’s past, exploring the origins of some of the characters as well as the development of the portal gun. The third segment is as action-packed as a puzzle platformer can be as the storyline climaxes in one last fight.

Throughout the game, we see some very interesting development of GLaDOS in her character arc. The game has the same dry, witty humor as the last one. (I think 2’s humor is better, though) Stephen Merchant as Wheatley was a great casting choice, as the humor told through the character is very much Merchant’s style. Our mute protagonist once again allows the player to step into the action as much as possible, without the immersion-breaking (if slight) from a main character talking independently of the player.

The soundtrack is awesome, but still doesn’t impede on the rest of the game. The music is very unintrusive at most points, but makes itself heard at key points in levels, making the player feel good about having figured something out.

Overall, Valve did a very good job in designing this game. The soundtrack is awesome, the gameplay is challenging and fun, and the story is very enjoyable and (at least for me) continues to be a fun experience to come back to once in a while. The player levels are a really cool way to continue enjoying the game after having beaten it a few times, and the co-op levels could almost be a game by themselves. Again, I would strongly recommend this to anyone who doesn’t already own the game because of its wonderful contributions to the gaming community.
